wikipedia_page.main: David Sturrock (born 22 February 1938) is a Scottish former footballer, who played as an inside forward in the Scottish Football League and the English Football League in the 1950s and 1960s.Sturrock began a five-year spell with local club Dundee United in the mid-1950s, joining English side Accrington Stanley for the 1960/61 season. He is reported as having made a total of 26 appearances for Accrington (scoring 7 goals), before moving to Southern League side Bedford Town. Sturrock moved back to his hometown of Dundee following the end of his playing career.
